meanings.def: a statue, stone, etc. that is built in order to remind people of an important past event or of a famous person who has died
examples: a war memorial (= in memory of soldiers who died in a war)
memorial to somebody/something a memorial to victims of the Holocaust
The memorial stands on the village green.
The president today unveiled a memorial to those who died in the disaster.
a makeshift memorial marked by posters and flowers
This ruin became a memorial for the victims of the bombing.

meanings.def: a thing that will continue to remind people of somebody/something
examples: The painting will be a lasting memorial to a remarkable woman.

meanings.def: a ceremony that is held to remember somebody who has died or an important past event
examples: a memorial for victims of the air crash
They are holding a memorial for it.

meanings.def: created or done in order to remember somebody who has died
examples: The memorial service will be held at a local church.
the John F Kennedy Memorial Hospital
